intro: Cremanthodium campanulatum var. brachytrichum, commonly known as the short-haired bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. The plant produces a basal rosette of leaves and has a compact growth habit, making it well adapted to its arid and high-altitude environment. It thrives in rocky soils and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
